title: useEffect
content:
# useEffect

### 1. What is a "side effect" in React? 

> Any code that react is not handling

- local storage
- web API
- web socket subscription
- two states to keep in sync
- any codes that affects an outside system 



### 2. What is NOT a "side effect" in React? 

> Anything that react is in charge of

-	Maintaining state, keeping the UI in sync with the data
-	React Primary Tasks

![](image-l75mh7kc.png)

### 3. When does React run your useEffect function? When does it NOT run the effect function?
   
-	Runs the effect as soonest as the component loads (First render)
-	On every re-render of the component (assuming dependencies array is empty)
-   Will not run when the values of the arrays of the dependecies stay the same.

### 4. How would you explain what the "dependencies array" is?

- Second parameter of the useEffect function
- To specify which changing values should trigger the useEffect action
